block.p: DEAR DIARY:

After spending a couple of days at home, I sent my daughter back to school with this letter addressed to the attendance office at Northern Highlands Regional High School in Allendale. Yes, I did what many of you have wanted to do. The letter said:
Dear Highlands Staff,
Please take Emily back. She was home on Thursday and Friday of last week with a bad cold, fever and sore throat.

During that time she watched at least 10 hours of television per day, drank five gallons of assorted juices and soft drinks, consumed countless snacks and left a pile of dirty linens, plates and glasses throughout the house.
Your cooperation would be greatly appreciated.
Kathleen Simon
LARCENY
From door to door for tricks or treats,
Attired in rags of disrepute,
Marauding bands solicit sweets
With shopping bags to stash their loot.
For fear of them, you dare not spurn
Tenacious Tim and Little Liz
Who, from your acquiescence, learn
How lucrative extortion is.
Bob McKenty
There it was on the October calendar -- E.S.P.A. testing for the fifth grade:
Tuesday, social studies;
Wednesday, visual and performing arts;
Thursday: makeup.
''Makeup?'' my son said. ''I don't even wear it. How do they expect me to pass a test on it?''
(If you want to thicken your lashes, do you wear (a) eyeliner; (b) eyebrow pencil; (c) mascara; (d) blush.)
Jessica Lauria
A sign in a shop window in Rancocas Woods: ''If we are closed, just shove the money under the door.''
Arthur Simeone
Scene: A young man was sitting on a bench in the Rockaway Townsquare mall with two children, a whiny boy about and an infant.
''What a beautiful baby,'' said one woman, who stopped to admire the infant. ''I wish her were mine.''
''Yeah, I wish he were yours,'' snapped the little boy.
Audrey Corn
Another mall story; a different mall. A man and a woman had stopped to inspect the offerings at a Japanese restaurant in the food court at Willowbrook Mall.
''Do you think we would like the sushi?'' the woman asked.
''No,'' he said. ''But I bet it would make great bait.''
MORE THAN ONCE
UPON A MATTRESS
My mattress is so soft and deep
I love to lay me down to sleep.
You know who made it. Take a guess . . .
The maker's name begins with ''S.''
Hint: Sealy, Serta, Simmons or Stearns and Foster.
Barbara Alpern
